Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.1__Will stand: : Waiting to see what the Lord will answer to my complaint, viz., that the Chaldeans, who are worse than the Jews, and who attribute all their success to their own strength, or to their idols, should nevertheless prevail over the people of the Lord. The Lord's answer is, that the prophet must wait with patience and faith: that all should be set right in due time; and the enemies of God and his people punished according to their deserts.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.5__As wine deceiveth: : Viz., by affording only a short passing pleasure; followed by the evils and disgrace that are the usual consequences of drunkenness; so shall it be with the proud enemies of the people of God; whose success affordeth them only a momentary pleasure, followed by innumerable and everlasting evils.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.6__Thick clay: : Ill-gotten goods, that, like mire, both burden and defile the soul.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.13__Are not these things: : That is, shall not these punishments that are here recorded, come from the Lord upon him that is guilty of such crimes.-- Ibid.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.13__The people shall labour: : Viz., the enemies of God's people.
Habakkuk or Habacuc__02.17__The iniquity of Libanus: : That is, the iniquity committed by the Chaldeans against the temple of God, signified here by the name of Libanus.
